title: WATCH:  Oldest gorilla in the world celebrates her 66th birthday
description: Fatou, the oldest gorilla in the world, feasted on fresh fruit and herbs to celebrate her 66th birthday, surpassing the average gorilla lifespan of 40 years by more than two decades.

title: Virginia lawmakers honor teacher shot by 6-year-old student
description: State resolution on Wednesday honored the teacher “for her courage and dedication to the safety of her students.”

title: Husband sentenced to life in prison in wife's 13-year cold case murder
description: A Minnesota man was sentenced for killing his wife in 2010 over the couple's debt, which he kept from her.

title: Biden announces plan to expand health care coverage for DACA recipients
description: President Biden announces plan to expand health care coverage for DACA recipients

title: John Ratcliffe is latest ex-Trump adviser to appear before Jan. 6 grand jury: Sources
description: Donald Trump's one-time director of national intelligence, John Ratcliffe, appeared before a grand jury probing efforts to overturn the 2020 election, sources said.

title: American couple held for ransom in Haiti released nearly a month later
description: After being held for ransom for nearly a month in Haiti, Jean Dickens and Abigail Toussaint were released after negotiations with their kidnappers, police told ABC News.

title: Jury selection underway in Dominion's $1.6 billion defamation case against Fox News
description: Jury selection is underway in Dominion's $1.6 billion lawsuit against Fox News, which Dominion claims defamed the voting machine company following the 2020 election.

title: Book ban battle threatens Texas library system's fate
description: Book bans in Llano County, Texas prompted a lawsuit that forced books back on the shelf. Local officials are considering closing the library system's doors.

title: Florida House pass 6-week abortion ban, expected to be signed by governor
description: The Florida House of Representatives voted to approve a six-week abortion ban to replace the state's 15-week ban. It now heads to Gov. Ron DeSantis for signing.

title: Minneapolis to pay $8.9M over Chauvin's actions before Floyd
description: The city of Minneapolis will pay nearly $9 million to settle lawsuits filed by two people who said former police officer Derek Chauvin pressed his knee into their necks years before he used that move in the killing of George Floyd

title: Dairy farm explosion injures 1 person, kills 18,000 cattle
description: An explosion at a dairy farm in the Texas Panhandle that critically injured one person and killed an estimated 18,000 head of cattle was the deadliest barn fire recorded since the Animal Welfare Institute began tracking the fires

title: FBI makes probable cause arrest in connection with classified documents leak
description: Jack Teixeira, a member of the Air National Guard, was taken into custody.

title: Ash from Russian volcano prompts Alaska flight cancellations
description: Alaska Airlines has canceled about two dozen flights in Alaska because of an ash cloud from a Russian Volcano

title: Air National Guard member ID'd as person of interest in classified docs leak: Sources
description: Biden said the DOJ was "getting close" in its investigation into the disclosure.

title: Arrest made in the killing of Cash App founder Bob Lee
description: A San Francisco official confirmed the arrest on Thursday.

title: Appeals court declines to rule in E. Jean Carroll defamation case against Trump
description: An appeals court has declined to answer whether then-President Trump was acting within the scope of his employment when he allegedly defamed E. Jean Carroll in 2019.

title: MLB ump Vanover still in hospital after hit in head by throw
description: Major League Baseball umpire Larry Vanover remained hospitalized after being hit in the head with a relay throw during Wednesday’s game between the New York Yankees and Cleveland Guardians

title: Michigan now requires universal background checks for all gun purchases
description: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer signed two gun safety bills into law requiring universal background checks for all purchases and safe gun and ammunition storage in homes.

title: Justice Department to take abortion pill fight to Supreme Court: Garland
description: This follows an appeals court ruling that would restrict access.

title: Former Nickelodeon star reported missing in Florida
description: Authorities in Daytona Beach, Florida, are searching for former Nickelodeon star Drake Bell who they say "is considered missing and endangered."

title: Florida travel advisory issued by state LGBTQ civil rights group
description: A travel advisory in the state of Florida has been issued by state LGBTQ civil rights group Equality Florida.

title: Jamie Foxx recovering after unknown 'medical complication,' daughter says
description: Jamie Foxx's daughter said he is recovering after an unknown "medical complication" earlier this week.

title: Women's tennis tour ends Peng Shuai-inspired China boycott
description: The women’s professional tennis tour will return to China later this year, ending a boycott instituted in late 2021 over concerns about the safety of former player Peng Shuai after she accused a high-ranking government official there of sexual assault

title: Trump back in New York for deposition in attorney general's $250 million civil suit
description: Former President Trump has arrived at the office of New York State Attorney General Letitia James for a deposition as part of her $250 million civil lawsuit against him.

title: US jobless claims rise but remain at historically low levels
description: U.S. applications for jobless benefits rose to their highest level in more than a year, but remain at relatively low levels despite efforts by the Federal Reserve to cool the economy and job market in its battle against inflation

title: Delta loses $363 million but says travel demand still strong
description: Delta Air Lines has reported a $363 million loss for the first quarter because of much higher spending on labor and fuel

title: Mary Quant, designer who epitomized Swinging 60s, dies at 93
description: Mary Quant, the designer whose fashions epitomized the Swinging 60s, has died at the age of 93

title: Taliban share rare audio message from supreme leader
description: The Taliban's supreme leader says Afghanistan will be ruined without justice, in a rare audio message shared on social media

title: Startup founder's alleged $175 million spotlights inequality in finance, experts said
description: Low interest rates and billion-dollar success stories have enticed tech investors.

title: First image of a black hole gets a makeover with AI
description: The image captured four years ago showed a fuzzy, fiery doughnut-shaped object.

title: China warns of rocket debris in area northeast of Taiwan
description: China’s local maritime authorities have issued a warning for possible rocket debris in waters northeast of Taiwan, saying ships would be banned from entering the area on April 16

title: Death penalty looms over Pittsburgh synagogue massacre trial
description: The Pennsylvania man charged with killing 11 people at a Pittsburgh synagogue tried for years to avoid a federal jury trial

title: Torrential rain floods Fort Lauderdale, strands residents
description: Over two feet of rain brought Fort Lauderdale to a halt on Wednesday afternoon, shutting down the city’s airport and stranding drivers on flooded streets.

title: Government urges certain software makers to take cybersecurity burden off customers
description: FBI and CISA urge "revamp" of certain software to take burden of cybersecurity off customers.

title: Fed staff expects banking crisis to cause a recession this year
description: The Federal Reserve staff expect a banking crisis to cause a recession this year.

title: School teacher shot dead in Dunkin' drive-thru line
description: Pennsylvania authorities are searching for the gunman who shot and killed a mom in her car while her 11-year-old son was in the backseat.

title: Germany appeals for reducing tension over Taiwan
description: Germany’s government has appealed for efforts to reduce tensions over Taiwan as the German foreign minister arrived in China for official talks

title: Asia stocks follow Wall St down after US recession warning
description: Asian stock markets have followed Wall Street lower after the Federal Reserve said its economists expect a “mild recession” this year

title: Appeals court partially blocks federal judge's abortion pill ruling
description: A federal U.S. appeals court late Wednesday partially blocked an unprecedented ruling by a single federal judge in Texas that reversed the FDA's approval of mifepristone.

title: WATCH:  Goose crashes Kansas City half-marathon
description: This goose didn't register for the annual Rock the Parkway half-marathon in Kansas City, but that didn't it stop it from joining the race.

title: After calls to resign, Feinstein seeks Judiciary replacement
description: U.S. Sen. Dianne Feinstein of California is asking to be temporarily replaced on the Judiciary Committee while she recovers from a case of shingles

title: Biden admin pauses asylum processing changes for migrants at border
description: The Biden administration is pausing a key effort to reform and increase asylum processing at the border.

title: Seoul: North Korea launches ballistic missile toward sea
description: South Korea says North Korea has launched a ballistic missile off the North’s east coast
